relationships.evidence_text: Welcome to the Y on Earth Community Podcast. I'm your host, Aaron William Perry.
Kate Wilson, the Vice President of Environmental and Social Responsibility at Vale Resorts.
Vale Resorts has a special responsibility to protect the unique mountains where it operates.
In her new role as Vice President of Environmental and Social Responsibility, Kate Wilson applies her two decades of experience to leading this critical work.

relationships.target: all four of the company's responsibility pillars
relationships.evidence_text: Kate now oversees all four of the company's responsibility pillars, sustainability.

evidence.target_surface: all four of the company's responsibility pillars

relationships.target: 100% renewable electricity across its North American operations
relationships.evidence_text: Under her leadership, the company reached 100% renewable electricity across its North American operations.

evidence.target_surface: 100% renewable electricity across its North American operations

relationships.relationship: is on track to achieve commitment to
relationships.evidence_text: is on track to achieve commitment to zero, the bold goal to reach a zero net operating footprint by 2030.
Before her promotion to Vice President in 2023, Kate served as the Senior Director of Sustainability.
Representing Vale Resorts, Kate has led sustainability discussions at the Bloomberg Sustainable Business Summit.
Kate has led sustainability discussions at Google's Travel Summit.
Kate has led sustainability discussions at Colorado Governor's Tourism Conference.
Kate has led sustainability discussions at MT 2030, a coalition of mountain towns.

relationships.target: greenhouse gas and sustainability strategy practice
relationships.evidence_text: Kate developed and led the greenhouse gas and sustainability strategy practice at the Cadmus Group for 10 years.

evidence.target_surface: greenhouse gas and sustainability strategy practice

relationships.evidence_text: She earned her Master of Applied Science in Environmental Policy and Management degree from the University of Denver.
and a Bachelor's degree in Environmental Policy from Colby College in Maine.

relationships.evidence_text: and leads the Mountain Collaborative for Climate Action.
